conclusion: To determine whether the elevator is in a state of weightlessness or overload at t = 4.5 seconds, we need to analyze the acceleration at that point in time.
Weightlessness occurs when the acceleration of the elevator is downward (negative), making the apparent weight less than the actual weight.
Overload (Superweight) occurs when the acceleration of the elevator is upward (positive), making the apparent weight greater than the actual weight.
The graph shows acceleration (a) on the y-axis and time (t) on the x-axis.
At t = 4.5 seconds, the acceleration is positive and appears to be around 1 m/sÂ².

premise: Since the acceleration is positive at t = 4.5 seconds, the elevator is experiencing an upward acceleration.
conclusion: The elevator is in a state of overload (superweight).
